pullRequest.body:
In this PR, it is shown that monomorphisms can be characterized in terms of pullback squares. Future applications of this include the fact that if a family of functors reflects isomorphisms, it shall also reflect monomorphisms and epimorphisms (provided suitable limits/colimits exist).

---

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

nodes.body:
Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7839796095/job/21393407485)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7839796095/job/21393407633)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7839796095/job/21393407784)
Does it make sense to also state the version with `IsIso c.snd`? Does it help to prove a TFAE statement, and possibly deduce these lemmas as 1-line corollaries?

In this particular case, it seems I would have to show the exact same number of implications in order to prove the TFAE, so that it would not be a shortcut.

I have added the `IsIso c.snd` variant, but in order to do that, I had to slightly refactor the flip of pullback cones and pushout cocones.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(CategoryTheory): characterization of epi/mono with limits

source.title: feat(CategoryTheory/Sites): the category of sheaves of sets is balanced
